intro: Lendneria angulata, commonly known as the angular leaf plant, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Acanthaceae and is characterized by its distinctive, angular-shaped leaves. The plant produces small, tubular flowers that are typically arranged in clusters, often in shades of purple or pink. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in woodland or coastal areas. Due to its unique appearance and ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in gardens.
